title: SetSegment (Function)
text:
FUNCTION SetSegment :
IString
Initializes the passed
IString
instance and uses the specified memory area for this purpose
Example for a 50 byte
IString
instance:
sValue : STRING(50) := UTF8#'CÃDâ¬Å¡Å¸Å  Ã¯Ã vÃ¤rÃ¿ Ã§Ã´Ãµl';
udiLength : UDINT := TO_UDINT(LEN(sValue));
   fbString : STR._UTF8String;
itfString : STR.IString := STR.SetSegment(fbString, ADR(sValue), SIZEOF(sValue)-1, udiLength);
Note
The final
NULL
byte of
sValue
is not part of the usable memory area of the string.
The values
sValue[0]
â¦
sValue[49]
are part of the usable Memory area.
This is the reason for the expression
SIZEOF(sValue)-1
when calling
SetSegment

rows: Pointer to the first byte of the memory.This address should aligned to a__XWORDboundary!
Size of the whole allocated memory
Length of the segment in bytes
